body.p:
Simon Livingston: stated that on Thursday night about 10 Oclock I arrived in the city from Evansville & went to my home in the Omnibus, on Floyd between Market & Main street, while I was knocking at the door (I had a pair of saddle Bags on my shoulder) in order to arouse my wife to open the door. Three men came up to me (accused are the same men) & asked me what I was doing there & I told them it was my home & one of them siezed me by the collar of my Coat another one struck me & one had hold of my Saddle Bags: I had some $25.00 in Silver in my saddle Bags: and some Spectacles & about $500. in paper money on my person I called watch & my wife who had come to the window, also called Watch & accused ranaway -- when they first accosted me, one of them asked me what I had in my saddle bags, the one who had hold of the saddle bags attempted to pull them away from me, the watch came up just as accused run. I peddle Spectacles & have lived on Floyd Street about 2 years. I believe it was Cunningham that struck me. Christian Votter lives in same house with last witness, on Thursday night last heard him knocking at the door & calling his wife then heard him say what do you want
& looked out of my window and saw Livingston & three men at the door & saw one of the men strike Livingston & then run away all three, Livingston & his wife who had been aroused, called for the watch very loud and the men ranaway. don't know who they were James Shindler, I & Cochran arrested accused. Heard the cry of murder & ran out from corner Floyd & Market & Saw three men running down Floyd towards main -- purused & arrested them. -- Jno. Cochran Same as last witness. -- Bail each in $300 -- to answer. --
The above contains substantially the Evidence in the case

Chas Miller
Richd. Cunningham
Edwd. Vincore
